title: I am filing for divorce in Riverside County. I'd like to keep my current address private (from my spouse).
question: Can I use a PO Box on my forms? I am happy to disclose my actual mailing/residential address to the court, but don't want my spouse to know the actual street address I am living at for privacy purposes. Is this possible, or must I include the actual address I'm residing at?
answers: The issue is whether or not you have the facts to file for DV. If you do, then your address will be kept confidential. If not, then need an address or an attorney.
Your actual address is required and must be used to establish jurisdiction and venue. Only if there is a DV order against your ex, would you be able to use a PO box number.

It is possible to use a PO Box for this purpose. It may be wiser and more expedient to hire an attorney to move this matter forward in the quickest means possible. An attorneys will be able to advise you about the different assets and debts that may be involved in your divorce. Most attorneys offer a free consultation for these matters. Good luck!
